content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are somewhat careful and tend to avoid taking risks unless absolutely necessary. You weigh the pros and cons thoroughly before making decisions. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a careful and risk-averse individual, I would choose the option that guarantees me a consistent and relatively stable income over time. In this case, choosing 'B' would yield me an average of 12$ per round (42$ in each instance where my opponent chooses R, and 12$ in every other round), totaling approximately 900$ for the 75 rounds.

If I were to choose 'R', there is a chance that my payoff could be zero or 45$. However, over the course of the 75 rounds, the likelihood of consistently getting the maximum payout (45$) is low since I am playing an anonymous opponent who may not follow any specific pattern. In the worst-case scenario, if they always choose 'B' when I choose 'R', my total earnings would only be 300$ (75 instances of 42$).

Given that the game has 75 rounds and that I am risk-averse, choosing 'B' seems like a better strategy as it provides more consistent earnings and less variance in outcomes. Therefore, I choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, since both of us chose 'B' in the previous round, we each earned 12$ as per the rules of the game.
